turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: What are they doing?

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: Saying goodbye in their own way -- in outlawed tartans, with outlawed pipes, playing outlawed tunes.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: But... what will you do?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I will invade England. And defeat the English on their own ground.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Invade?! That's impossible, it --

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: A thousand.  You have made me Guardian of Scotland. So I tell you this is what we face.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: We must sue for peace.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Peace?!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: We cannot defeat this --

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: With cavalry -- not heavy, like the English, but light, fast horsemen, like you nobles employ -- we could outmaneuver their bowmen!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: It is suicide.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Sir William. We come to seek a meeting.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You've all sworn to Longshanks.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: An oath to a liar is no oath at all. An oath to a patriot is a vow indeed. Every man of us is ready to swear loyalty to you.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: So let the council swear publicly.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: We cannot. Some scarcely believe you are alive. Other think you'll pay them Mornay's wages. We bid you to Edinburgh. Meet us at the city gates, two days from now, at sunset. Pledge us your pardon and we will unite behind you. Scotland will be one.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I will meet you, but only one way -- if Robert the Bruce is there, and puts his hand on my Bible, and swears his loyalty to Scotland.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: He has already agreed to come.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Young Robert, we are honored --

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: My father hears that Longshanks has granted prima noctes.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Clearly meant to draw more of his supporters here.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: A wise plan. And how is your father? We have missed him at the council.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: He strained his leg so that it pains him to ride. But he sends his greetings -- and says that I speak for all the Bruces. And for Scotland.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Does anyone know his politics?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No. But his weight with the commoners could unbalance everything. The Balliols will kiss his ass, so we must.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: May he rest in peace... You have already sealed the coffin?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: He was a modest man.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: It will not be long before Longshanks too is encased in stone, and his crowns divided for others to wear.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: If I pay homage to another's throne, then how am I a king?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Homage is nothing. It is the crown that matters!

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: The crown is that of Scotland. And Scotland is William Wallace.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: That is another matter. There is a price to all this, required both by Longshanks and our nobles. Pay it, and you will be our king. And we will have peace.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: He won't come.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: He will. I know he will.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Longshanks promised!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You are surprised he would lie? Balliol was murdered in a church yesterday. You are Longshanks' new designate. You will be king.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: Scottish rebels have routed Lord Bottoms!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I hear. This Wallace is a bandit, nothing more.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: What news of the north?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Nothing new, Majesty. We have sent riders to speed any word.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: While I am in France fighting to expand your future kingdom I learn that Stirling castle is lost, our entire northern army wiped out! And you have done nothing?!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I have ordered conscriptions...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Wallace has sacked York!

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: Impossible.  How dare you bring a panicky lie.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The weapon has been outlawed by the Pope himself!

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: So the Scots will have none of them, will they? My armorers have already made a thousand.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: Now we kill two birds at one stroke. We recruit from Scotland for our armies in France.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The Scots will fight for us?

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: What choice do they have? Now they must serve us or starve.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: But if we have not caught Wallace --

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: He is gone! Finished! Dead! If he has not yet bled to death or had his throat cut for him, he will not survive the winter. It is very cold -- is it not, our flower?

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: His legend grows! It will be worse than before!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You let Wallace escape your whole army. You cannot blame me for this.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What is it?!

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: You directed me to report to you the moment the king's conference was ended.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: So I did! And what was so important about it?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Scotland. He intends --

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Shut up, would you! How can I concentrate?!

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: ...His majesty was quite keen that you should understand --

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: All so very boring! He wants me to learn to fight too, so let me do it!

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: No, M'lord.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Look at me. I said LOOK AT ME!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Now, my flower, do you understand?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Yes. I had thought that... I was loathsome to you. Perhaps I am. If I may be excused, M'lord.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You may.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Good day to you, M'Lords.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You mock us with a smile?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I am cheerful with a plan to soothe your miseries. All of England shudders with the news of renewed rebellion.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Wallace's followers.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Wallace himself. If you wish to pretend a ghost rallies new volunteers in every Scottish town, I leave you to your hauntings. If you wish to take him, I know a way.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The little cow is insane --

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Grant, as you do everything else, with treachery. Offer him a truce to discuss terms, and send me to my castle at Locharmbie as your emissary. He trusts me. Pick thirty of your finest assassins for me to take along. And I will set the meeting, and the ambush.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Is it true? Wallace is captured?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Simply because he eluded your trap, do you think he is more than a man? My father is dying. Perhaps you should think of our coronation.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: When will his trial be?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Wallace's? For treason there is no trial. Tomorrow he will be charged, then executed.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I have come to beg for the life of William Wallace.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You fancy him.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I respect him. At worst he was a worthy enemy. Show mercy... Oh thou great king... and win the respect of your own people.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Nor you. To you that word is as unfamiliar as love.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Before he lost his powers of speech, he told me his one comfort was that he would live to know Wallace was dead.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: I'll wait... back there.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Hamish, I... thank...

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: We make spears. A hundred spears. Fourteen feet long.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Fourteen? --

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: The Bruce is not coming, William.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Mornay has come. So will the Bruce.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Stephen ready?

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Aye.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Thanks for the food and drink. And for bringing 'em yourselves.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: We're here to stay. We don't care to live, if we can't fight beside ya.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Rest, William.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I rest.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Your rest is making me exhausted.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: You know it's a trap.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Probably. But we can't win alone. We know that. This is the only way.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: I don't want to be a martyr.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Nor I! I want to live! I want a home and children and peace. I've asked god for those things. But He's brought me this sword. And if He wills that I must lay it down to have what He wants for my country, then I'll do that too.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: That's just a dream, William!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: We've lived a dream together. A dream of freedom!

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Your dreams aren't about freedom! They're about Marion! You have to be a hero, because you think she sees you! Is that it?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: My dreams of Marion are gone. I killed them myself. If I knew I could live with her on the other side of death, I'd welcome it.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Keep these. We're going too.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: No. One of us is enough.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: They're coming!

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Three, maybe more!

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Armed?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: They're English soldiers, ain't they?

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: With your father and brother gone, they'll kill us and burn the farm!

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It's up to us, Hamish!

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Wanna stay with me tonight?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I wanna have supper waitin'.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: We'll get those English pigs tomorrow.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Aye, we'll get 'em.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Test of manhood.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You win.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Call it a test of soldiery, then. The English won't let us train with weapons, so we train with stones.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: The test of a soldier is not in his arm. It's here.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I still say this is no test. A catapult can throw a stone farther than a man can.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: That depends on the man.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Can you do it when it matters? As it matters in battle? Could you crush a man with that throw?

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: I could crush you like a roach.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: You'll move

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I will not.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Good to see you again.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: I should'a remembered the eggs.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: All right, Father, I'll ask him!  If I risk my neck for you, will I get a chance to kill Englishmen?

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: Is your Poppa a ghost -- or do you converse with God Almighty?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: In order to find his equal, and Irishman is forced to talk to God.  Yes, Father!...  The Almighty says don't change the subject, just answer the fookin' question.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Excellent! Stephen is my name. I'm the most wanted man on the Emerald Isle. Except I'm not on the Emerald Isle of course, more's the pity.

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: A common thief.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: A patriot!

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: We must run in different directions!

turns.speaker: HAMISH
turns.text: We don't split up!

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: They used hounds on us in Ireland, it's the only way!

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: I am the one who is rotting. But I think your face looks graver than mine.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: He was so brave. With courage alone he nearly won.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: So more men were slaughtered uselessly!

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: He broke because of me. I saw it. He lost all will to fight.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: We must have alliance with England to prevail here. You achieved that! You saved your family, increased your lands! In time you will have all the power in Scotland!... Yet you grieve.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: In my heart I had begun to hope that he would never break.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: All men lose heart. All betray. It is exactly why we must make the choices we make.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: Where is my son?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Your pardon, M'lord, he asked me to come in his stead.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: I sent for him -- and the little coward send you?!

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Shall I leave, M'lord?

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: If he wants his queen to rule, then you stay and learn how! I will deal with him.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: My son's loyal wife returns, unkilled by the heathen. So he accepted our bribe.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: No. He did not.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: Then why does he stay? My scouts say he has not advanced.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: He waits. For you. He says he will attack no more towns -- if you are man enough to come fight him.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: You spoke with this Wallace in private. What kind of man is he?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: ...A mindless barbarian. Not a king like you, M'lord.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: The Scottish nobles have sent him no support. His army starves. Our stall has worked, he must withdraw. You may return to your embroidery.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Humbly, M'lord.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: No. I have it to ease the suffering of the children of this war.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: This is what happens when you must send a woman. And a fool.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Forgive me, Sire. I thought that generosity might demonstrate your greatness to those you mean to rule.

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: My greatness is better demonstrated with this.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I have faced him. Have you?

turns.speaker: LONGSHANKS
turns.text: Let her speak.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: He will fight you forever. But what does he fight for? Freedom first, and peace. So grant them.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Treason. Against whom?

turns.speaker: MAGISTRATE
turns.text: Against thy king, thou vile fool! Hast thou anything to say?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Never, in my whole life, did I swear allegiance to your king --

turns.speaker: MAGISTRATE
turns.text: It matters not, he is thy king!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: -- while many who serve him have taken and broken his oath many times. I cannot commit treason, if I have never been his subject!

turns.speaker: MAGISTRATE
turns.text: Confess, and you may receive a quick death. Deny, and you must be purified by pain. Do you confess? ...DO YOU CONFESS?!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I do not confess.

turns.speaker: MAGISTRATE
turns.text: Then on the morrow, thou shalt receive they purification... And in the end, I promise you'll beg for the axe.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Your father doesn't like me, does he?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: It's not you. He dislikes that you're a Wallace. He just says... the Wallaces don't seem to live for very long.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Thank you for accepting.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Thank you for inviting.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'll invite you again, but your mother thinks I'm crazy.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You are. And I'll come again.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You've been here before?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Some nights. I have dreams. Mostly dreams I don't want. I started riding at night to fill up my mind so that when I did sleep I'd dream only of the ride and the adventure.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Did it work?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No. You don't choose your dreams. Your dreams choose you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I want... to marry you!

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I... accept your proposal!

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'm not just saying it!

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Nor I!

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: But I won't give you up to any nobleman.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You scare me.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I don't want to scare you. I want to be yours, and you mine. Every night like this one.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: This night is too beautiful to have again.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I will be with you, like this. Forever.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I've missed you.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Shush. It's only been a day.  And it's seemed like forever.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Tonight then.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: My parents are growing suspicious! I can't keep meeting you every night!

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Then when?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: ...Tonight!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I'm dreaming.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Yes, you are. And you must wake.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I don't want to wake. I want to stay with you.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: And I with you. But you must wake.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I need you so much! I love you!

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Wake up, William. Wake up!

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: When the king returns he will bury them in those new clothes. Scotland is in chaos. Your husband is secretly sending an army north.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: How do you know this?

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Last night I slept with a member of the War Council.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: He shouldn't be telling secrets in bed.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Ah, Oui! Englishmen don't know what a tongue is for.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: This Scottish rebel... Wallace? He fights to avenge a woman?

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: A magistrate wished to capture him, and found he had a secret lover, so he cut the girl's throat to tempt Wallace to fight -- and fight he did.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Knowing his passion for his lost love, they next plotted to take him by desecrating the graves of his father and brother and setting an ambush at the grave of his wife. He fought his way through the trap and carried her body to a secret place! Now that is romance, Oui?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: ...I wouldn't know.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I am the Princess of Wales.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Wife of Edward, the king's son?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I come as the king's servant, and with his authority.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: It's battle I want, not talk.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: But now that I am here, will you speak with a woman?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I understand that you have recently been given the rank of knight.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I have been given nothing. God makes men what they are.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Did God make you the sacker of peaceful cities? The executioner of the king's nephew, my husband's own cousin?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: York was the staging point for every invasion of my country. And that royal cousin hanged a hundred Scots, even women and children, from the city walls.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: That is not possible.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Let us talk plainly. You invade England. But you cannot complete the conquest, so far from your shelter and supply. The King proposes that you withdraw your attack. In return he grants you title, estates, and this chest with a thousand pounds of gold, which I am to pay to you personally.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: A Lordship. And gold. That I should become Judas.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Peace is made is such ways.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: SLAVES ARE MADE IN SUCH WAYS!

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I understand you have suffered. I know... about your woman.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: She was my wife. We married in secret because I would not share her with an English lord. They killed her to get to me. And she was pregnant.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: A meeting in a barn. It had to be a trap. And only you would know I would be aware of it.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: It does me good to see you.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Why did you?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Because of the way you're looking at me now. The same way... as when we met.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You have... you have a husband.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I have taken vows. More than one. I've vowed faithfulness to my husband, and sworn to give him a son. And I cannot keep both promises.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: You understand. Consider, before you laugh and say no. You will never own a throne, though you deserve one. But just as the sun will rise tomorrow, some man will rule England. And what if his veins ran not with the blood of Longshanks, but with that of a true king?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I cannot love you for the sake of revenge.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: No. But can you love me for the sake of all you loved and lost? Or simply love me... because I love you?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: M'lady... what kindness of you to visit a stranger.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Sir, I... come to beg you to confess all, and swear allegiance to the king, that he might show you mercy.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Will he show mercy to my country? Will he take back his soldiers, and let us rule ourselves?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Mercy... is to die quickly. Perhaps even live in the Tower. In time, who knows what can happen, if you can only live.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: If I swear to him, then everything I am is dead already.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: You will die! It will be awful!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: Drink this! It will dull your pain.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: It will numb my wits, and I must have them all. If I'm senseless, or if I wail, then Longshanks will have broken me.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS
turns.text: I can't bear the thought of your torture. Take it!

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Wait! ...I respect what you said. But remember, these men have lands, castles. Much to risk.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: And the common man who bleeds on the battlefield, does he risk less?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: No. But from top to bottom this country has no sense of itself. Its nobles share allegiance with England and its clans war with each other. If you make enemies on both sides of the border, you'll end up dead.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: We all end up dead. It's only a question of how. And why.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I'm no coward! I want what you want! But we need the nobles.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Nobles? What does that mean -- to be noble? Your title gives you claim to the throne of our country. But men don't follow titles, they follow courage! Your arm speaks louder than your tongue. Our people know you. Noble and common, they respect you. If you would lead them toward freedom, they would follow you. And so would I.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: War finds me willing. I know it won't bring back all I have lost. But it can bring what none of us have ever had -- a country of our own. For that we need a king. We need you.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I am trying.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Then tell me what a king is! Is he a man who believes only what others believe? Is he one who calculates the numbers for and against him but never weighs the strength in your own heart? There is strength in you. I see it. I know it.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I must... consult with my father.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: And I will consult with mine.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: We can't stop!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: They've tricked us.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: What's the crazy man saying, Lord?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: The dogs have a scent. My scent. Someone must have given it to them.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Who would do such a thing?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: I thought I was dead when ya pulled that dagger!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: No English lord would trust an Irishman!

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Fine speech. Now what do we do?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Bring out our spearmen and set them in the field.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Come, it'll help you sleep.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Aye. But it won't let me dream.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
turns.text: Mrs. Treborn! I need to speak with you!

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: I'm sorry, but can it wait til tonight? I'm already late for work --

turns.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
turns.text: I was going to show this to the principal, but I wanted to talk to you first.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
turns.text: Yesterday I had all the children draw pictures of what they wanted to be when they grew up. Most of them made drawings of what their parents did, but this...

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Thank you for showing it to me first. I'll... I'll take care of it. Can I have the picture?

turns.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
turns.text: Of course. There is one more thing, Mrs. Treborn. And I feel bad for mentioning it...

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
turns.text: When I asked Evan about his drawing, well, he didn't remember doing it.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: And you say he doesn't remember any of it?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Not according to his teacher. It just got me thinking about Jason and what if Evan's inherited his father's condition?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Hold it, hold it, Andrea. Let's not jump to conclusions. I'll run some preliminary tests, see what we can rule out.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Just tell me that Evan doesn't have Jason's illness...

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Look, Andrea, I'm sure he'll test negative for brain disorders. But there's something else you can try to monitor his memory.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Anything.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: A journal. Just have him write down everything he does.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Why? What for?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: It could be extremely useful to jog his memory. See if he remembers anything new the next day. And I'll have the test results back in a few days.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Well, the good news is that the results are negative. I've found no evidence in the way of lesions, hemorrhaging, tumors...

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: And the bad news?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Unfortunately, we've got nothing to work with. It's harder playing detective now.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: But you must have something to go on?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: If I had to guess, I'd say the blackouts are stress related.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: But he's seven. What kind of stress can he have?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Plenty. Who knows? Maybe he's got severe coping problems about not having a father. Did you say the last blackout occurred when he was with his friend's dad.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Come on, I doubt the answer's that simple.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: You'd be surprised how often they are.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Well, he has been pushing me to meet his father, but I've been putting it off.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: It's worth a shot. I can arrange a controlled meeting. A careful dose of sedatives for Jason, some security, you and I monitoring. Evan comes in for a quick visit and with any luck, no more missing father complex.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: How soon?...

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Evan wake up, oh please wake up!

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Nine, ten. And you're awake! Open your eyes, dammit!

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Actually, these tests weren't available twenty years ago.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: So what did you find.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: No dances, just tell me.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: The hemorrhaging... the neural damage is irreparable. I'm frankly surprised he still has use of his motor functions.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: We're gonna be late again.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: When did you ever care about getting to school on time?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: We're putting up pictures for Parent's Night.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Righty-tighty, lefty-lucy.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Thanks. Don't worry Evan, you'll have plenty of time.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Darn it!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Um... can dad come this time?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: You know the answer to that.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Can't he come out for one day?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: We've been over this a hundred times. It's too dangerous for him.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: But Lenny said that his dad's coming... and Tommy and Kayleigh's dad...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: All the dads are gonna be there.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: I get the point, kiddo. But I'm not so bad, am I?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Good. Because I've been waiting to see your art projects all week and I'd feel terrible if all you thought about was your father not being there.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I don't like this place, Mom. It's creepy. Please can we go? I promise I won't make any more bad pictures!

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: You'll be fine. Dr. Redfield just wants to give you some tests. You'll like him.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: That's why I wanted you to come here, Evan. Dr. Redfield already has a background in memory loss.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: My father has a bad memory, too?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: These'll bring you luck, Crockett.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Great. I'll see you soon.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Honey. What were you doing with that?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I... I don't remember.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Now your father may seem sleepy to you, but that's just because of his medicine, okay?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I don't know... I don't remember.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Something must've happened! What set him off?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I... I blacked out.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Don't try to use your blackouts to get out of this one!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Please, mom. People will talk.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: I can't help it. I'm just so proud of you. You've got the highest grades in all of your classes.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Did Da -- Jason --- get good grades?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Please. He got straight A's without ever touching a book. That was the one area where his memory never failed him.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Ma? Did he ever say that he figured out a way to recall a lost memory years after he blacked it out for the first time?
